headlines: Sensex jumps 1,000 points, Nifty crosses 16,900
text: Indian equity benchmarks rallied on Thursday, led by strong buying interest in technology and financial stocks. BSE Sensex jumped over 1,000 points or 1.79% to 56,817 in the afternoon trade, while the broader NSE Nifty moved 266 points or 1.60% higher to trade at 16,908. Infosys, Kotak Mahindra Bank and Wipro were among top gainers.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: SpiceJet shares hit 2-year low after airline's flight operations cut by 50%
text: Shares of SpiceJet tanked as much as 10% on the BSE in Thursday's early trading session, hitting a 2-year low. This comes after DGCA ordered the Indian airline company to cut its approved fleet to 50% this summer for eight weeks. The DGCA order came as the airline reported multiple snags in a short period of time.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Oil price rises as Russia cuts gas flow to Europe, US supply concerns
text: Amid a report of lower inventories in the US and Russia cutting gas flows to Europe, oil price rose by $1 a barrel. Brent crude rose by $1.19 to $105.59 a barrel, while WTI crude gained $1.47 to settle at $96.45. After Russia's invasion of Ukraine in February, oil reached a 14-year high of $139 a barrel in March.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: Meta posts its first ever quarterly drop in revenue
text: Meta has recorded its first ever quarterly drop in revenue. Total revenue fell 1% to $28.8 billion in the second quarter ended June 30, from $29.1 billion last year. The company said it expects third-quarter revenue to fall to $26 billion and $28.5 billion, which would make it a second year-over-year drop in a row.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Who are the richest Indian women as per Hurun?
text: HCL Technologies' chairperson Roshni Nadar Malhotra has retained her position as India's richest woman, with a 54% jump in her wealth to ₹84,330 crore in 2021, as per the Kotak Private Banking-Hurun list. Nykaa Founder Falguni Nayar is the richest self-made woman with a net worth of ₹57,520 crore. Biocon's Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw is the third richest woman in the country.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75% for the 2nd consecutive time
text: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its benchmark interest rate by 0.75% for the second straight time, matching the largest increase since 1994. The move will raise its key rate to a range of 2.25% to 2.5%, its highest level since 2018. This comes after annual inflation in US hit a new four-decade high of 9.1% in June.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: World's richest family, the Waltons, loses $11.4 bn as shares of Walmart decline by 8%
text: World's richest family, the Waltons, lost $11.4 billion on Tuesday after Walmart Inc slashed its earnings outlook for the second time this year. Shares of the retailer, which is controlled by the family, tumbled nearly 8% in New York trading. Walmart Inc said adjusted earnings per share will decline as much as 13% this year.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Maruti Suzuki India reports 130% surge in net profit in Q1FY23
text: Maruti Suzuki India on Wednesday reported 130% surge in net profit to ₹1,012.8 crore for Q1FY23. The carmaker attributed the surge mainly to a low base in the year-ago period. It had posted a net profit of ₹440.80 crore in the April-June quarter of the last fiscal when the company's earnings were adversely hit due to second wave of COVID-19.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: Zomato allots 4.6 crore shares to employees at ₹1 apiece
text: Amid a fall in the share price of Zomato, the food delivery player has allotted 4,65,51,600 equity shares from its ESOP (employee stock option plan) pool at an exercise price of one rupee. Zomato's shares have lost over 74% of their value from the all-time peak of ₹169.10. Zomato's shares are currently trading at around ₹43.00 apiece on the BSE.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Which 15 companies have withdrawn 'misleading' ads according to the government?
text: According to Central Consumer Protection Authority's Chief Commissioner Nidhi Khare, the companies which withdrew "misleading" ads included Siyaram Silk, Lifebuoy, Kent RO, Asian Paints, Blue Star, Zodiac, Safal Hospitality and Maintenance Services and Berger Paints India Limited. Blue Star Limited, AM Webshop India Pvt. Ltd (Spaces), Naaptol and Sensodyne have also withdrawn "misleading" ads.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Asia's richest woman Yang Huiyan loses half her fortune in China property crisis
text: Asia's wealthiest woman lost more than half her fortune over the past year as China's real estate sector was hit by a cash crunch, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Yang Huiyan, a majority shareholder in Chinese property giant Country Garden, saw her net worth plunge by more than 52% to $11.3 billion from $23.7 billion a year ago.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Sensex jumps to 55,816 points, Nifty settles at 16,641
text: The benchmark indices bounced back on Wednesday, ending a two-day losing streak. The Sensex jumped 0.99% to end at 55,816.32 points, while the Nifty surged 0.96% to 16,641.8 points. The recoveries were supported by buying in IT and bank stocks. Sun Pharma, L&T and SBI emerged as the biggest gainers, while Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank and Bajaj Auto slipped.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: Wall Street rises after Alphabet, Microsoft's quarterly results
text: With Microsoft and Alphabet posting a surge in quarterly results, the investor sentiment at Wall Street was lifted on Wednesday. Alphabet shares rose by 4.5% propelled by Google ad sales, while Microsoft rose by 3.1% following its double-digit fiscal revenue growth forecast. S&P 500 Communication Services index rose for the first time in five days and tech stocks surged 2.8%.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: G7 plans price-capping mechanism on Russian oil exports by Dec 5
text: The Group of Seven (G7) economies, the US, Canada, Japan, Germany, France, Italy and Britain, aim to have a price-capping mechanism on Russian oil exports by December 5. This would curb Moscow's revenue and prevent it from financing the war on Ukraine. "The goal...is to align with the timing that the EU has...put in place," a senior G7 official said.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: Digital payments in India grew 29% annually at March-end 2022: RBI
text: Digital payments across India grew nearly 29% in a year through March 2022, as per RBI's digital payment index (DPI). The index, which is constructed using March 2018 as its base period, stood at 349.3 in March 2022 against 270.59 in March 2021. "DPI has demonstrated significant growth, representing rapid adoption and deepening of digital payments," RBI said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's imports from China surged 29% in 5 years: Government
text: India's total imports from China surged by nearly 29% in the past five years, the government said. Animal or vegetable fats, ores, slag and ash, mineral fuels, chemicals, fertilizers, dyeing extracts, plastic, paper, cotton, textile fabrics, footwear, glassware, iron, steel, copper, nuclear reactors, boilers, machinery, appliances and furniture were part of the major imports.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: India has not imposed any country specific ban on imports: Piyush Goyal
text: Responding to a question on whether Centre has taken any steps to impose a ban on Chinese products, Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal told Parliament that India has not imposed any country specific ban on imports. "India and China, are both members of the WTO, and any trade restriction imposed must be WTO compliant," he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Saudi Arabia to set aside $80 bn for Prince's megaproject
text: Saudi Arabia will set aside $80 billion (300 billion riyals) for Prince Mohammed bin Salman's flagship megaproject, Neom, alongside investing in companies that will operate from there. The Prince plans to expand the fund by engaging investors and through an IPO of Neom in Saudi Arabia. Neom is the Prince's megaproject to turn a desert expanse into a high-tech region.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: Gold jewellery demand likely to witness slump this year: WGC
text: Weaker economic growth in several big markets could lead to a slump in the demand for gold jewellery, the World Gold Council (WGC) said. The WGC wrote that China's zero-COVID-19 policy and its struggling realty sector could cause a slow recovery in demand. India could also witness a lower demand because of the falling rupee and higher import duty.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: Oil prices rise on high gasoline demand in US, low inventories
text: With a rebound in gasoline demand in the US and an improved risk appetite among investors, oil surged by more than $1 a barrel on Thursday. Brent crude futures for September rose to $107.82 a barrel, while US WTI was at $98.70 a barrel. US crude oil stockpiles fell by 4.5 million barrels last week, according to Energy Information Administration.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: BPCL's $1.6-bn investment plan in Brazil gets Cabinet's approval
text: The Union Cabinet on Wednesday approved an additional investment of $1.6 billion by state-owned Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) in a Brazilian oil block. The investment will be made by Bharat PetroResources Ltd (BPRL), BPCL's wholly-owned subsidiary, for developing the BM-SEAL-11 Concession Project in Brazil. BPRL has a 40% stake in the block, while Brazil's Petrobras operates at 60%.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: Meta crosses $1-bn annual revenue run rate for ads on Reels
text: Meta has crossed a $1 billion annual revenue run rate for ads on Reels. Founder and CEO Mark Zuckerberg said that in the April-June period, the company saw an over 30% increase in the time "people spent engaging with Reels across Facebook and Instagram". Reels is Meta's rival of TikTok, the short video-making platform.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: I-T dept raids multiple hospitals in NCR in tax evasion case: Report
text: Income Tax department has conducted search operations on the premises of multiple private hospitals in Noida, Faridabad and Gurugram for allegedly evading taxes, according to reports. Metro hospital, Accord hospital and Sarvodaya hospital are some hospitals that are being raided. A 14-15 member team was present at each hospital and was scanning transactions of the last three years.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bajaj Finance shares jump over 9% a day after Q1 results
text: Shares of Bajaj Finance increased by over 9% to ₹6,982.20 apiece in early trade on Thursday. For the quarter ended June 30, the NBFC reported its highest-ever consolidated net profit at ₹2,596 crore propelled by the income due to loan growth. The company said that its total income rose to ₹9,283 crore in Q1FY23 as against ₹6,743 crore in Q1FY22.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: Tata Motors' consolidated net loss widens to ₹5,007 cr in Q1
text: Tata Motors reported a consolidated net loss of ₹5,007 crore in the quarter ended June 2022, the company said in a regulatory filing on Wednesday. The auto major had posted a consolidated net loss of ₹4,451 crore in the corresponding period last fiscal. "We expect demand to remain strong despite worries on inflation and geo-political risks," Tata Motors said.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: L&T shares surge 4% day after June quarter result
text: A day after reporting a 45% jump in consolidated net profit for the quarter ending June, shares of Larsen & Toubro (L&T) surged nearly 4% on Wednesday morning. The L&T scrip started at ₹1,758 and reached an intra-day high of ₹1,819. The scrip of the engineering and construction conglomerate closed at ₹1,795.40.
author: Srishty Choudhury

headlines: Sensex gains 519 points, Nifty surges by 139 points
text: Benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Thursday with Sensex and Nifty surging 519.99 points and 139.80 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 56,336.31 points and Nifty at 16,781.60. Bajaj Finserv, Bajaj Finance, IndusInd Bank, Tech Mahindra and SBI were among the major Nifty gainers, while Tata Motors, Sun Pharma, Dr. Reddys Labs, UltraTech Cement slipped.
author: Srishty Choudhury
